chargeHist.descr: Harboring/Aiding a Felon (A/B/C/D or unclassified felony/life)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda N. Rotar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amanda N. Rotar is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amanda N. Rotar was found guilty of Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.47(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John Andrew Newton (in 15CF359)  and attorney Brent Varner (in 17CF66).  Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Parties have rec/rev PSI.  No corrections to be noted.  Court notes all parties met in jury room and watched video of VIS.  State notes that was a video from stepdaughters of victim A.I.  Court notes he also has copies of other written VIS's.  P.I. reads statement from victim's sister.  P.W. reads statement.  DE has no one speaking on her behalf.  Atty Hoffman makes statement.  Atty Newton makes statement.  Atty Varner makes statement.  DE makes brief statement.  Court quotes Atty Schulenburg from sentencing hearing of co-DE earlier today.  Court makes statement.  Court urges DOC to allow her to do whatever programming they have to help her while she's there.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court admonishes DE re: felony firearms warnings, voting rights and appeal rights.  WEDS form also provided to DE.

17CF66 
4 years probation (concurrent to sentence/probation in 15CF359)
$518.00 costs/surcharges
DNA sample to be provided
Conditions of probation:
Participate in and comply w/Sauk County Adult Treatment Court
Expungement if probation is successfully completed
39 days credit if probation would be revoked

15CF359 
3 years prision (1 1/2 yrs IC and 1 1/2 yrs ES)
Conditions of extended supervision:
Counseling per agent
Prior approval of agent for any residence that she takes up
$518.00 costs/surcharges
DNA sample to be provided
Restitution of $1,000.00 to be divided between the 2 people requesting restitution but none to crime victim compensation
$1,000.00 cash bail posted is to be paid out to the restitution 
DE is eligible for SAP and CIP
251 days credit to be applied

Support Letter L.R.
Cover Letter from Court to order PSI

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John Andrew Newton (15CF359) and attorney Brent Varner (17CF66).  Linda Ann Hoffman and Kevin Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Varner states DE will waive her right to prelim today in 17CF66.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over in 17CF66.  State files information in 17CF66.  Atty Varner acknowledges rec. information/waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max. penalties.  State files amended information in 15CF359.  Atty Newton acknowledges rec. amended information in 15CF359 and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties in 15CF359 amended information.  State states agreement.  Parties are attempting to get DE into Sauk Co Adult Treatment Court at this time which would lessen the 60 day sentence.  Atty Newton explains status of that/should know something w/in the week.  DE is in agreement.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE pleads NC to Ct 3 in 15CF35 and Ct 1 in 17CF66.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Court advises DE of voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  Atty Newton and and Atty Varner waive the DE's right to PSI.  State agrees.  Sentencing set for 12/7/2017 at 3:00 pm.  Atty Newton explains why bond is being revoked in 17CF66 and requests daily reporting requirement be removed.  State responds that they would notify the PD that reporting would cease while DE is in custody.  Court requests clarification.  Court orders bond revoked in 17CF66 and directs DE remain in custody pending sentencing hearing on 12/7/2017.  DE will not be required to report to BPD daily as she has been on previous bond.

***RECOMMENDATIONS***
15CF359
Cts 1, 2 and 4:  Dismissed
Ct 3:  NC

17CF66
Ct 1:  NC
Ct 2:  Dismissed

All other counts are dismissed

Probation for 4 years on each count
Conditions of probation:
***17CF66 only - 60 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence***
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 x 2 to be paid to Clerk of Court's Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
AODA/treatment and any other counseling/conditions per agent
No contact w/the immediate family of A.I.
No contact w/A.P., J.R., C.N., or I.L.
Contact w/M.H. per agent and then only for co-parenting reasons
Expungment on 17CF66 ONLY if no other convictions and probation not revoked and all probation conditions successfully completed
15CF359 has 221 days sentence credit if probation would be revoked

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John Andrew Newton.  Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in custody.   Linda Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to modify bond only motion to be addressed today.  Attorney Newton addresses the motion to modify bond further.  Has always resided locally, been employed and mother of small child.  No history of violence.  Request $500.00 cash bond.  ADA Ryan argues bond. Reasonable bail set at initial appearance.  Request court deny bail modification.  Attorney Newton gives final statement.   Court discusses charges, history and rules to deny the motion to amend the bond at this time.  Further motions pending to be set.

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John A. Newton.  Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in custody.  Linda Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Newton acknowledges rec. information and waives reading.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Atty Newton stands mute to all charges.  Court enters NG pleas to all four counts.  Court notes there will be a joint scheduling conference held w/all 4 DE attorneys in these matters after the final arraignment is held next week. Court is adjourned.
Arraignment at 12-17-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Linda Hoffman and Dennis Ryan appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney John A. Newton in court for Defendant Amanda N. Rotar.  Motion to modify bond.  Atty. Newton makes argument.  Sites statute 969.01(4).  Modify to $1000 Cash bond w/check in to the jail every other day @ 4 pm to make sure she is in the area.  Atty. Hoffman objects to any reduction.  Court denies motion to modify bond - enticement of fleeing is great.  Preliminary hearing showed there was probable cause.

Motion hearing at 10-27-2015 11:00 am
Motion hearing at 10-16-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John A. Newton.  Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hoffman calls Det.  George Bonham - BPD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE Rotar.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Nash.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Witness ID's DE Harvey.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Covey stipulates to the ID of his client DE Robinson.  Atty Hoffman continues direct of Det. Bonham.  Atty Berkos does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Schulenburg does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Newton does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  Atty Covey does cross-exam of Det. Bonham.  State has no questions and the witness is excused.  Defense attorney's have no witnesses at this time.  State waives argument.  Atty Berkos states argument.  Atty Schulenburg states argument.  Atty Newton states argument.  Atty Covey states argument.  Court finds as to each of the four DE's that there is probable cause to believe a felony was committed and binds them all over for trial.  Court addresses motion for bond modification filed by Atty Newton.  Atty Newton agrees to have that heard at a later date.  Atty Hoffman files a stipulation as to Nash's case and Robinson's case.  Atty Hoffman requests hearing be set in re: to the release of the victim.  Atty Berkos responds re: release of the body.  States he would like to review the autopsy report prior to making a decision.  State is aware of the objection.  Court states they will be in touch w/the State and Atty Berkos to set a hearing date/time.  Atty Covey notes that the RD on 11/3/2015 will likely not be necessary and an arraignment will be set at a later date and time.  Court says matter will remain on the calendar for now but doesn't believe all four if any of the DE's will be here for that date.

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in court with attorney John A. Newton.  Defendant Amanda N. Rotar in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Atty Newton addresses his motion to dismiss.  Atty Ryan responds.  Court asks question of Atty Ryan.  Atty Newton responds.  Court finds probable cause within the four corners of the complaint so the motion to dismiss is denied.

Defendant Amanda N. Rotar appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State amends complaint to A.P. not A.R. of surviving victim.  Court so amends.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  DE does qualify for PD representation.  State requests $25,000.00 Cash bond and gives history.  Atty. ORourke requests PA bond based on history.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  $10,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/coactors J.R., C.N., M.H. or surviving victim A.P.; Not leave State of WI  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
